{bc}to destroy, consume, or waste by or as if by eating

dt.t: expenses {it}ate{/it} up the profits
gadgets that {wi}eat{/wi} up too much space

dt: {bc}to consume more than one can easily provide or afford
{bc}to deprive of profit, dominance, or success

et: Middle English {it}eten{/it}, from Old English {it}etan{/it}; akin to Old High German {it}ezzan{/it} to eat, Latin {it}edere{/it}, Greek {it}edmenai{/it}
shortdef: to take in through the mouth as food : ingest, chew, and swallow in turn
to destroy, consume, or waste by or as if by eating
to bear the expense of : take a loss on

dt: {bc}any of several psychological disorders (such as anorexia nervosa or bulimia) characterized by serious disturbances of eating behavior

dt: {bc}a macaque ({it}Macaca fascicularis{/it}) of southeastern Asia, Borneo, and the Philippines that sometimes feeds on marine crustaceans and shellfish and is often used in medical research

dt: {bc}violent or highly militant in disposition, bearing, or policy

dt.t: a {wi}fire-eating{/wi} radical

dt: {bc}feeding on or destroying flesh or soft tissue

dt.t: A Kentucky man was diagnosed with a {wi}flesh-eating{/wi} infection after he went camping along the Green River.
… infestation by blowflies whose eggs hatch into {wi}flesh-eating{/wi} maggots.
But according to Eugenie Clark, a University of Maryland zoologist, {ldquo}the white shark, the largest {wi}flesh-eating{/wi} fish, is anything but a mindless, constant eating machine.{rdquo}
Natural history buffs will find … a 145-million-year-old foot from the Allosaur, one of the largest {wi}flesh-eating{/wi} dinosaurs …

shortdef: feeding on or destroying flesh or soft tissue

dt: {bc}a bacterium (such as a {d_link|Group A|Group A} streptococcus or {d_link|MRSA|MRSA}) that causes {d_link|necrotizing fasciitis|necrotizing fasciitis}

dt.t: Blunt trauma that doesn't tear the skin can also permit entry of {wi}flesh-eating bacteria{/wi}, according to the CDC.
The rise of superbugs that can survive multiple antibiotics—such as MRSA, the notorious {ldquo}{wi}flesh-eating bacterium{/wi}{rdquo}—has turned once-trivial infections into persistent problems.
… the notorious streptococcus strain known as {ldquo}the {wi}flesh-eating bacterium{/wi}.{rdquo}

shortdef: a bacterium (such as a Group A streptococcus or MRSA) that causes necrotizing fasciitis

dt.t: Many people carry streptococcus without ever getting sick, so medical experts are baffled as to why some people develop the {wi}flesh-eating disease{/wi} while others do not.
Known as necrotizing fasciitis, {wi}flesh-eating disease{/wi} is a rare infection that spreads quickly throughout the body just under the skin.

dt: used to say that a person can only know if something is good or bad by trying it

dt: {bc}any of various tarantulas {dx_def}see {dxt|tarantula||1}{/dx_def} that are reputed to sometimes prey on small birds

dt.t: Hairy South American {wi}bird spiders{/wi}, which stalk lizards and small birds, grow as big as dinner plates, spanning 10 inches from toe to bristly toe.

When attacked themselves, {wi}bird-eating spiders{/wi} rise on to their four hind legs and bare their fangs at the intruder. Normally, though, they are calm and docile animals and will rarely attack or bite anything other than potential food.

shortdef: any of various tarantulas that are reputed to sometimes prey on small birds
